isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STEERING COLUMN ASSEMBLY, STANDARD - 5000, 9000 CONV. - REMOVE AND INSTALL - STEERING COLUMN

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: For most servicing procedures, it will be necessary to remove the steering column. This can be accomplished with the steering wheel in place or removed.

step1.para: Remove the pinch bolt from the lower yoke end of the steering slip shaft. Separate the slip shaft from the yoke. Not the position of the arrows on the yoke and shaft. Use these for alignment on reassembly.
If the steering wheel is removed, it is necessary to replace the steering wheel nut to prevent the steering shaft from sliding out of the steering jacket tube.
Remove the turn signal and trailer brake controls from the steering column.
Disconnect the horn wire at the connector.
Remove the lower bracket cap and cover ( Figure 4).
Remove the upper bracket cap and lift the steering column from the cab. Be careful not to tear the rubber boot or break the steering tube locating pin in the steering column mounting bracket.

Place the steering column in the cab through the boot, being careful not to tear the rubber boot. Align the hole in the steering jacket tube with the locating pin on the steering column mounting bracket.

Install the upper bracket cap and tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART
. .

Install the universal joint cover and lower bracket cap. Tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART
.
Install the turn signal and trailer brake controls on the steering column.

If the steering wheel has been removed, re-install as outlined. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, STEERING WHEEL
.

Re-align the yoke and slip shaft with the arrows. Install the pinch bolt on the end of the steering slip shaft and tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART
.
